alert.note: Alert for Fremont; Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 11 at 4:25PM MDT until July 11 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HAYDEN PASS BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN FREMONT AND NORTHEASTERN SAGUACHE COUNTIES... At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicates that earlier thunderstorms which produced heavy rain over the Hayden Pass Burn Scar have subsided. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding will remain possible from the earlier heavy rain. Excessive rainfall over the warning area may cause mud slides near steep terrain. The mud slide can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hayden Pass Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hayden Pass Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hayden Pass Burn Scar. This includes the following high risk locations... Cutty`s Resort On Hayden Creek Road and Big Cottonwood Creek along County Road 40. This includes the following streams and drainages... Piney Creek, San Luis Creek, Big Cottonwood Creek, Little Cottonwood Creek, Oak Creek, Hayden Pass Creek, Arkansas River and Middle Prong Hayden Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Earlier heavy rainfall may continue to cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks... streams...and ditches in the Hayden Pass Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
